intro: Trichera arvensis subsp. pannonica, commonly known as the Pannonian thornweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and agricultural fields. It is an annual or biennial herb that thrives in temperate climates and is often considered a weed in cultivated areas. Its botanical features make it easily distinguishable from other members of its genus.
